Noblesville.Potter's Covered Bridge: Potter's Covered Bridge, also known as Potter's Bridge and Potter's Ford Bridge, is a historic covered bridge located near Noblesville in Noblesville Township, Hamilton County, Indiana. It was built in 1871, and is a Howe Truss structure measuring 260 feet long, 22 feet wide, and 20 feet tall. The single span bridge rests on limestone abutments and has walls clad in vertical board siding.
